channel.title: 1961 Couchiching conference
channel.description:
The 1961 Couchiching Conference, a summer symposium on national and international affairs put together by the Canadian Institute on Public Affairs and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, assembles for its 30th annual meeting. The theme of the 1961 conference was "diplomacy in evolution."

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Realities of disarmament
item.description: The fifth episode of the conference focuses on disarmament.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Weapons.

item.title: Opening address
item.description: The first episode contained the conference's opening address by Scottish author, journalist, and academic Ritchie Calder, as well as part of a subsequent question and answer session.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)

item.title: Canada's role in international relations
item.description: The seventh and final episode of the conference focuses on Canada's role in world politics. The main speaker is the Premier of Manitoba, Duff Roblin.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)

item.title: Independence and the developing states
item.description: The third program from the 1961 conference focuses on independence, nationalism, and developing countries.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)

item.title: Sovereignty and international control
item.description: The sixth episode of the conference focuses on Canadian sovereignty and international relations.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)

item.title: Technology and the developing states
item.description: The second program from the 1961 conference focuses on technology and developing countries.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)

item.title: Realities of war
item.description: The fourth program from the 1961 conference focuses on modern war and its effects on society. Dr. Henry Kissinger is the featured speaker.
item.dc:creator: Wilson, Bob
item.dc:subject: Forums (Discussion and debate)
